metadata.title: USN-6362-1 -- .NET vulnerability
metadata.description: Kevin Jones discovered that .NET did not properly process certain X.509 certificates. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6362-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  aspnetcore-runtime-6.0 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 aspnetcore-targeting-pack-6.0 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-apphost-pack-6.0 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-host - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-hostfxr-6.0 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-runtime-6.0 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-sdk-6.0 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-sdk-6.0-source-built-artifacts - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-targeting-pack-6.0 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-templates-6.0 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet6 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 netstandard-targeting-pack-2.1 - 6.0.122-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 No subscription required  aspnetcore-runtime-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 aspnetcore-targeting-pack-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-apphost-pack-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-host-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-hostfxr-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-runtime-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-sdk-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-sdk-7.0-source-built-artifacts - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-targeting-pack-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-templates-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet7 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 netstandard-targeting-pack-2.1-7.0 - 7.0.111-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 No subscription required
